justification: The study evaluates the efficacy of a home-based computerized multi-modal training program targeting robust and pre-frail older adults, which is highly relevant to longevity research as it focuses on interventions aimed at improving physical and cognitive health in aging populations. The content provides insights into adherence, usability, and user perception of such technologies, all critical factors for successful long-term implementation in promoting healthy aging.
key_terms: home-based training, multi-modal program, robust older adults, pre-frail older adults, adherence, usability, cognitive health
